result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Alexis A Beaver was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes: To be paid at the Clerk of Courts Office.   $50 represents Ignition Interlock Device surcharge.
To be paid at the Clerk of Courts Office.  $32.50 represents Blood Draw Test fee.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
Not to drive with any alcohol in system.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to serve 1st 6 months of 1 year sentence.  2nd 6 months is stayed pending compliance with Probation.  May serve in any other Jail if at no expense to Chippewa County.  Electronic monitoring is authorized if qualifies.
